vote.title: To authorize an expenditure within the Neighborhood Initiatives subfund in support of Wednesdays with Wyche. ($5,000.00)
vote.description:
Explanation 
This ordinance authorizes the establishment of a general budget reservation to support expenses associated with Wednesdays with Wyche. 
 
Wednesdays with Wyche is the community engagement plan to educate constituents and residents about upcoming public utilities and sustainability committee legislation, topics and initiatives. 
 
This plan includes up to 12 events, such as townhalls and roundtables, throughout the city of Columbus  
 
The funds will be used for food and refreshments for longer meeting sessions, venue rental space, marketing/educational materials and any audio/visual that may be necessary. The use of funds to provide food and beverage to attendees serves a public purpose in that it increases the likelihood that residents will participate in engaging with Council. 
 
Fiscal Impact: Funding is available within the Neighborhood Initiatives subfund. 
 
Title 
 
To authorize an expenditure within the Neighborhood Initiatives subfund in support of Wednesdays with Wyche. ($5,000.00) 
 
Body 
 
WHEREAS, City Council prioritizes educating residents and constituents on current legislation, important topics and relevant initiatives; and 
 
WHEREAS, the Public Utilities and Sustainability committee actively works, in conjunction with city departments, on a variety of topics, legislation and programs to meet the city’s climate action plan and other initiatives; and 
 
WHEREAS, City Council will host up to 12 events across the city educating residents and constituents about the committee work under the Wednesdays with Wyche program; 
 
WHEREAS, it has become necessary in the usual daily operation to authorize a general budget reservation in advance of year end to accommodate activities in 2026; now, therefore, 
 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS: 
 
SECTION 1. That the expenditure of $5,000.00, or so much thereof as necessary, is hereby authorized in the Neighborhood Initiatives subfund, fund 1000, subfund 100018, per the accounting codes in the attachment to this ordinance.   
 
SECTION 2. That the distribution of food and beverages associated with the execution of this grant agreement are deemed to be for a public purpose.  Food and beverage costs are authorized in an amount not to exceed the per-person, per-meal costs under the applicable per diem by meal established by location as set by the Federal General Services Administration.  
 
SECTION 3. That this ordinance shall take effect at the earliest date allowable by law.
